SEARCH
Package au.csiro.pathling.search

Class TokenSearchValue

java.lang.Object
au.csiro.pathling.search.TokenSearchValue
public class TokenSearchValue extends Object
Represents a parsed token search value.

Token search values can be specified in several formats:

  • code - matches any resource with the given code
  • system|code - matches resources with the given system and code
  • |code - matches resources with the given code and no system
  • system| - matches any resource with any code in the given system

System and code use Optional semantics:

  • Optional.empty() - no constraint for that field
  • Optional.of("value") - must match exact value
See Also:
  • Token Search

  • Method Details

    • parse

      @Nonnull public static TokenSearchValue parse(@Nonnull String value)
      Parses a token search value string.

      Parsing rules:

      • "male" → system=empty, code="male", explicitNoSystem=false
      • "http://example.org|male" → system="http://example.org", code="male", explicitNoSystem=false
      • "|male" → system=empty, code="male", explicitNoSystem=true
      • "http://example.org|" → system="http://example.org", code=empty, explicitNoSystem=false
      Parameters:
      value - the token value string to parse
      Returns:
      the parsed token search value

    • getSystem

      @Nonnull public Optional<String> getSystem()
      Gets the system URI.
      Returns:
      the system URI to match, or empty for no constraint (any system)

    • getCode

      @Nonnull public Optional<String> getCode()
      Gets the code value.
      Returns:
      the code to match, or empty for no constraint (any code)

    • requiresSimpleCode

      @Nonnull public String requiresSimpleCode()
      Returns the code value for types that only support simple code values (no system).

      This method validates that:

      • No system was specified (system|code syntax is not allowed)
      • A code value is present

      Use this for FHIR types that don't have a system field, such as: ContactPoint, code, uri, id, string, boolean.

      Returns:
      the non-null code value
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if a system was specified or code is missing
